Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content:
In the event that Whistleblower is dismissed by the business operator provided for in item (i) of paragraph (1) of the preceding Article on the basis of Whistleblowing provided for in each of the following items, the dismissal shall be void:

(i) In the case where it is considered that the Reportable Fact has occurred or is about to occur: Whistleblowing to the Business Operator, etc.

(ii) In the case where there are reasonable grounds to believe that the Reportable Fact has occurred or is about to occur: Whistleblowing to an Administrative Organ having the authority to make a disposition or recommendation, etc. concerning said Reportable Fact

(iii) In the case where there are reasonable grounds to believe that the Reportable Fact has occurred or is about to occur, and if any of the following applies: Whistleblowing to a person who is found to be necessary to notify the Reportable Fact of the occurrence or increase of damage caused by the Reportable Fact to the person:

(a) In the case where there are reasonable grounds to believe that Whistleblowing provided for in the preceding two items would be disadvantageous such as dismissal.

(b) In the case where there are reasonable grounds to believe that Whistleblowing provided for in Item (i) may destroy evidence pertaining to the Reportable Fact, fake or altered.

(c) In the case where the Whistleblower was requested by the Business Operator without justifiable grounds not to do so as provided for in the preceding two items

(d) Documents (including records prepared in electronic form, magnetic form, or any other form not recognizable to human perception); In the case where, after twenty days have elapsed since Whistleblowing provided for in Item (i) was made pursuant to Article 9, no notice has been given from the Recipient of Labor, etc. to the effect that an investigation will be conducted with respect to the Reportable Fact or the Recipient of Labor, etc. has not conducted the investigation without justifiable grounds

(e) In the case where there are reasonable grounds to believe that there is an imminent danger to the life or body of an individual which may occur or arise

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content:
In addition to what is provided for in Article 3, the business operator listed in item (i) of paragraph (1) of Article 2 shall not give any disadvantageous treatment such as demotion, salary cuts or other treatment to Whistleblower who is or was used on the basis of Whistleblowing provided for in each item of Article 3.

(2) In addition to what is provided for in the preceding Article, the business operator listed in item (ii) of paragraph (1) of Article 2 shall not request the Whistleblower to change the Dispatched Workers to the business operator carrying out the Worker Dispatching pertaining to said Whistleblower or otherwise treat them disadvantageously on the basis of the Whistleblowing provided for in the items of Article 3 by the Whistleblower.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: Workers who make Whistleblowing as provided for in each item of Article 3 shall endeavor not to harm the legitimate or public interest of others.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: In the event that Whistleblowing provided for in paragraph (1) of the preceding Article has been made by mistake to an Administrative Organ which does not have the authority to make Disposition or Recommendation, etc. on the Reportable Fact pertaining to said Whistleblowing, the Administrative Organ which has the authority to make Disposition or Recommendation, etc. on the Reportable Fact pertaining to said Whistleblowing shall be instructed.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: Any business operator who receives Whistleblowing provided for in Item (i) of Article 3 from a Whistleblower in writing shall endeavor to notify the Whistleblower without delay that the Whistleblower has stopped the Reportable Fact or has taken any other measure considered necessary for rectification, if there is no Reportable Fact pertaining to said Whistleblowing.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: The purpose of this Act is to aim at the protection of Whistleblowers by establishing the Nullity, etc. of Dismissal of Whistleblower due to Whistleblowing as well as the measures to be taken by business operators and administrative organs with regard to Whistleblowing, and to ensure compliance with the provisions of laws and regulations for the protection of the lives, bodies, property and other interests of citizens, thereby contributing to the stability of the lives of the people and the social economy.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content:
(Effective Date)

Article 1 This Act shall come into force as from the date specified by a Cabinet Order within a period not exceeding two years from the day of promulgation, and shall apply to Whistleblowing made after the enforcement of this Act.

(Review)

Article 2 Approximately five years after this Act comes into effect, the government shall review the state of enforcement of this Act, and shall take necessary measures based on the results thereof.

Article 57 Before this Act comes into effect, each Act prior to its revision by this Act (including orders issued thereunder). Dispositions such as Dispositions such as Dispositions rendered by previous state organs pursuant to the provisions of this Article and the following Article referred to as"Old Laws and Regulations"shall, in addition to those otherwise provided for by laws and regulations, be rendered to the respective Acts revised by this Act (including orders issued thereunder) after the enforcement of this Act. It shall be deemed to be a Disposition of Authorization, etc. or any other act issued by a corresponding state organ pursuant to the corresponding provisions of this Article and the following Article referred to as"New Laws and Regulations".

(2) Applications, notifications and other acts that have been filed or made to a state organ prior to the enforcement of this Act pursuant to the provisions of the old laws and regulations shall be deemed, after the enforcement of this Act, to be applications, notifications and other acts that have been filed or made to a state organ prior to the enforcement of this Act pursuant to the corresponding provisions of the new laws and regulations, except as otherwise provided by laws and regulations.

(3) With regard to matters for which an application, notification, or other procedures must be filed with an organ of the previous state pursuant to the provisions of the old laws and regulations prior to the enforcement of this Act, for which the procedure has not been implemented with an organ of the previous state prior to the date of enforcement of this Act, the provisions of the new laws and regulations shall apply, after the enforcement of this Act, by deeming that such procedures have not been implemented with an organ of the corresponding state pursuant to the corresponding provisions of the new laws and regulations, except as otherwise provided by laws and regulations.

(Transitional Measures Concerning Effect of Order)

Article 58 The Cabinet Office Ordinance provided for in Article 7, paragraph (3) of the Act for Establishment of the Cabinet Office or the Ministerial Ordinance provided for in Article 12, paragraph (1) of the National Government Organization Act issued pursuant to the provisions of the Former Laws and Regulations shall, after the enforcement of this Act, be effective as the corresponding Digital Agency Ordinance provided for in Article 7, paragraph (3) or the corresponding Ministerial Ordinance provided for in Article 12, paragraph (1) of the National Government Organization Act issued pursuant to the corresponding provisions of the New Laws and Regulations.

(Delegation to Cabinet Order)

Article 60 In addition to what is provided for in Article 15, Article 16, Article 51, and the preceding three Articles of the Supplementary Provisions, any necessary transitional measures for the enforcement of this Act (including transitional measures concerning penal provisions) shall be specified by a Cabinet Order.
